summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the status of 'Operation Leap Year,' an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The email indicates the operation is 'on hold' but remains open in case Epstein breaches an agreement.

persons.name: A. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The email is sent from his office address, and he is the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida overseeing the Epstein case.

events.title: Status inquiry for Operation Leap Year
events.description: An email inquiry is made regarding the status of 'Operation Leap Year,' the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The response indicates the operation is 'on hold' but remains open.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida dated August 15, 2008.
It references 'Operation Leap Year,' which is the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The status of Operation Leap Year is described as 'on hold' but remains open in case Jeffrey Epstein breaches an agreement.
The email is part of a 'caseload certification' process, indicating administrative review of ongoing cases.
The correspondence shows internal communication about the paused but not closed Epstein investigation in 2008.
